Identification.LongTitle: Pest Control Products Incident Reporting Regulations

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Health, pursuant to subsection 67(1) of the Pest Control Products Acta, hereby makes the annexed Pest Control Products Incident Reporting Regulations.

Subsection.Text: The following definitions apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the Pest Control Products Act. (Loi)
domestic animal means an animal that is under the control of humans and dependent on them for its survival. (animal domestique)

incident means an incident described in section 2 whose effects relate to the health or environmental risks or the value of a pest control product. It does not include an incident that results from an act or activity that would constitute an offence under the Criminal Code. (incident)
incident report means a report that contains the information described in section 3 and that is received by the Minister from a registrant or an applicant. (déclaration d’incident)
individual of a species at risk means an individual of a species set out in the List of Wildlife Species at Risk in Schedule 1 to the Species at Risk Act. (individu d’une espèce en péril)

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of applying the definition incident report in subsection (1), the information need not be proved or substantiated by the registrant or applicant in order to be included in the report.

Section.Text: Incidents are classified, according to the subject of the exposure to the pest control product and the degree of severity of their effects, into the following categories:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a human being,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an incident whose effect is a human death,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an incident that has a major effect on a human, when an individual has or has had symptoms that indicate a condition that could be life-threatening or result in adverse reproductive or developmental effects or in chronic disability,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an incident that has a moderate effect on a human, when an individual has or has had symptoms that are more pronounced, more prolonged or of a more systemic nature than minimally bothersome symptoms, and for which some form of treatment is usually indicated, although the symptoms do not indicate a life-threatening condition and the individual is likely to return to their pre-exposure state of health without any chronic disability, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an incident that has a minor effect on a human, when an individual has or has had minimally bothersome symptoms that normally resolve rapidly, including skin rash, itching, conjunctivitis, drowsiness, transient cough, headache, joint pain, agitation, restlessness or mild gastro-intestinal symptoms such as self-limited diarrhea, stomach cramps or nausea;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a domestic animal,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an incident whose effect is a domestic animal death,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an incident that has a major effect on a domestic animal, when a domestic animal has or has had symptoms that indicate a condition that could be life-threatening or result in adverse reproductive or developmental effects or in chronic disability,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an incident that has a moderate effect on a domestic animal, when a domestic animal has or has had symptoms that are more pronounced, more prolonged or of a more systemic nature than minimally bothersome symptoms, and for which some form of treatment is usually indicated, although the symptoms do not indicate a life-threatening condition and the animal is likely to return to its pre-exposure state of health without any chronic disability, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an incident that has a minor effect on a domestic animal, when a domestic animal has or has had minimally bothersome symptoms, such as skin, eye or respiratory irritation, that normally resolve rapidly;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of the environment,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an incident that has a major effect on the environment, when

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the number of individuals of a group or subgroup set out in column 1 or 2, respectively, of the schedule that die is at least the number set out in column 3, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: an individual of a species at risk has or has had at least one of the symptoms set out in column 6 of the schedule,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an incident that has a moderate effect on the environment, when the number of individuals of a group or subgroup set out in column 1 or 2, respectively, of the schedule that have or have had at least one of the symptoms set out in column 6 is the number, or a number within the range, set out in column 4, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an incident that has a minor effect on the environment, when the number of individuals of a group or subgroup set out in column 1 or 2, respectively, of the schedule that have or have had at least one of the symptoms set out in column 6 is less than the number set out in column 5;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an incident whose effect is residues in food, when a pest control product or one of its components or derivatives is detected in food in an amount that would result in the sale of the food being prohibited under section 4 of the Food and Drugs Act;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an incident of packaging failure, when packaging failure is observed that could result in the exposure of humans to a pest control product or in injury to humans; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an incident whose effects are identified in a scientific study, when the effects are observed during a human epidemiological study or a scientific investigation, whether concluded, discontinued or ongoing, and the study or investigation is sponsored by the registrant or applicant and indicates

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any new health or environmental hazard associated with a pest control product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any health or environmental risk associated with a pest control product that may be greater than the risk determined at the time of registration, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the presence of a previously undetected component or derivative of a pest control product.

Subsection.Text: The following information that is received by a registrant or an applicant about an incident that is associated with their pest control product or with any pest control product that has the same active ingredient, and that is required by sections 7, 8 and 16, is prescribed information for the purpose of section 13 of the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: contact information for the registrant or applicant;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the incident occurred;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date on which the registrant or applicant received the information about the incident;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the city, province or state, and country where the incident occurred;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the identification of the pest control product;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: information about the application of the pest control product, including the site, method and date of its application;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the category of the incident, determined in accordance with section 2;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: information about the circumstances of the exposure to the pest control product, including the site, date, route of exposure, weather conditions, duration and subject information, which, in the case of a human subject, is restricted to age, gender and whether the subject is pregnant;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: information about the incident and its effects, including the symptoms, duration and outcome; and

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: scientific test information, including information about the sample, the method of analysis and the results.

Subsection.Text: The following information about an incident that is associated with the registrant’s or applicant’s pest control product or with any pest control product that has the same active ingredient, and that is required by section 9, is prescribed information for the purpose of section 13 of the Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: contact information for the registrant or applicant;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the title and date of the study and the name of the author;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the identification of the pest control product;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the category of the incident, determined in accordance with section 2;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the scientific study and the test data generated during the study; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the type of scientific study, an indication of which of subparagraphs 2(f)(i) to (iii) is the reason for submitting it, and the information the study reveals about the incident and its effects.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), all information about incidents and their effects that is required by these Regulations is deemed to have been received by the registrant or applicant on a certain date if it is received on that date by

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an employee or agent of the registrant or applicant; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an employee or agent of a related corporation, within the meaning of the definition related persons in subsection 251(2) of the Income Tax Act, whether the related corporation is located in or outside Canada.

Subsection.Text: In the case of an incident whose effects are identified in a scientific study, if the information is received by a person described in paragraph (1)(b), the information is deemed to have been received by the registrant or applicant one year after its receipt by that person.
Incident reports must be filed in English or in French.

In the case of a scientific study published in a language other than English or French, if the translation of the study cannot be completed within the prescribed time for filing the incident report, the registrant or applicant must provide the Minister with a summary of the study, in English or French, when the report is filed.
In a case described in subsection (2), the registrant or applicant must send the completed translated study as soon as possible after the report is filed.

Section.Text: Every registrant and applicant must file with the Minister, in accordance with the time limits specified in sections 10 to 14, a complete and accurate report of any information set out in subsection 3(1) that they receive about an incident that occurs in Canada, in accordance with the categories described in paragraphs 2(a) to (e).

Every registrant and applicant must file with the Minister, in accordance with the time limits specified in sections 10 to 12, a complete and accurate report of any information set out in subsection 3(1) that they receive about an incident that occurs in the United States, if the incident fits within any of the following categories described in section 2: an incident whose effect is a human death, an incident that has a major effect on a human, or an incident whose effect is a domestic animal death.

Every registrant and applicant must file with the Minister, in accordance with the time limit specified in section 11, a complete and accurate report of any information set out in subsection 3(2) about an incident whose effects are identified in a scientific study.
Every registrant and applicant must file an incident report within 15 days after the day on which they receive information about any incident in the following categories:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an incident whose effect is a human death;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that occurs in Canada that has a major effect on a human; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that has a major effect on the environment.

Subsection.Text: Every registrant and applicant must accumulate the information that they receive in a month about incidents in the following categories and file the required incident reports before the end of the next month:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that occurs in the United States that has a major effect on a human;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that has a moderate effect on a human;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that occurs in Canada whose effect is a domestic animal death;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that has a moderate effect on the environment;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an incident whose effect is residues in food;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an incident of packaging failure; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: an incident whose effects are identified in a scientific study.

Section.Text: Every registrant and applicant must accumulate the information that they receive in a reporting period set out in column 1 of the table to this section about incidents in the following categories and file the required incident reports on the date set out in column 2:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that occurs in the United States whose effect is a domestic animal death; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that has a major effect on a domestic animal.

row.entry: February 28, or February 29 in the case of a leap year

Section.Text: Subject to subsection 14(4), every registrant and applicant must accumulate the information that they receive in a 12-month period established in accordance with section 14 about incidents in the following categories and file the required incident reports in accordance with that section:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that has a minor effect on a human;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that has a moderate effect on a domestic animal;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that has a minor effect on a domestic animal; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that has a minor effect on the environment.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) to (4), every registrant and applicant the first letter or number of whose name is set out in column 1 of the table to this subsection must file the incident reports described in section 13 and the annual summary described in section 15 within two months after the end of the reporting period set out in column 2.

row.entry: First letter or number of registrant’s or applicant’s name
March 1 to February 28, or February 29 in the case of a leap year
T, U, V, W, X, Y or Z

Subsection.Text: If a registrant or an applicant changes their name after having filed a first incident report described in section 13 or a first annual summary described in section 15, the time limit for filing subsequent reports and summaries under those sections remains the time first established in accordance with subsection (1).

If two or more registrants or applicants amalgamate after one of them has filed a first incident report described in section 13 or a first annual summary described in section 15, the time limit for the amalgamated registrant or applicant filing subsequent reports and summaries under those sections is the earliest of their time limits first established in accordance with subsection (1).

If a registrant ceases for any reason to be the registrant of a particular pest control product, they must file the incident reports described in section 13 and the annual summary described in section 15, with respect to all information that they receive about that product before the day on which they cease to be the registrant, within one of the following time limits:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before the day on which they cease to be the registrant; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on or before the day that is 15 days after that day.

Subsection.Text: The first incident report described in section 13 and the first annual summary described in section 15 that are filed in accordance with subsection (1) may be for a reporting period shorter than 12 months.
A registrant must file an annual summary with respect to an active ingredient in the following circumstances:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the active ingredient is a component of a pest control product that is the subject of an incident report filed by the registrant in the year; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the active ingredient is implicated in at least 10 such reports in the same year.

Subsection.Text: The annual summary must contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: with respect to each incident report referred to in paragraph (1)(b), the category of incident described in section 2; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a concise critical analysis of all the data relating to the active ingredient, including a comparison with analyses of past years and commentary on any changes that arose in the year in the risk profile of any pest control product of which the active ingredient is a component.

Subsection.Text: The annual summary must be filed at the same time as the incident reports required by section 13.

Section.Text: Every registrant must provide the Minister with all information set out in subsection 3(1) that they receive and that has not already been reported, within 24 hours after the Minister requests it for the purpose of responding to a situation that endangers human or domestic animal health or the environment.

Every registrant and applicant must keep a record of every completed incident report and any information they have that relates to or is in connection with that report for six years after the day on which the report is filed with the Minister. The record must be provided to the Minister, on request, for the purpose of making comparisons or a historical analysis of the incidents or to permit the Minister to exercise powers under the Act.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the Minister must place all incident reports that relate to registered pest control products in the Register, including any supplemental information in support of the reports that is volunteered by the registrant or applicant, such as any relevant opinion or commentary.
The Minister must remove from the incident reports, and from any supplemental information provided in connection with them, all personal information as defined in section 3 of the Privacy Act.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force six months after the day on which they are registered.

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: Death, impairment of health, reproductive impairment or congenital anomalies

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: Death, impairment of health, reproductive impairment or congenital anomalies

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: Death, impairment of health, reproductive impairment or congenital anomalies

row.entry: Death, impairment of health, reproductive impairment or congenital anomalies

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: Small mammals such as bats, rabbits, squirrels and mice

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: Death, impairment of health, reproductive impairment or congenital anomalies

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: Large or solitary mammals such as foxes, deer and moose

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: Death, impairment of health, reproductive impairment or congenital anomalies

row.entry: Death, impairment of health, reproductive impairment or congenital anomalies

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: Death, impairment of health, reproductive impairment or congenital anomalies

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: Death, impairment of health, reproductive impairment or congenital anomalies

row.entry: Large aquatic invertebrates, such as lobsters, mussels and shrimp
Death, impairment of health, reproductive impairment or congenital anomalies

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: 3,000 bees from each of 5 or more colonies, or 30% of the bees in any one colony

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: 1,000 or more but fewer than 3,000 bees from each of 5 or more colonies, or 10% or more but less than 30% of the bees in any one colony

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: 10% of the bees in any one colony

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: All other non-target terrestrial invertebrates, including beneficial insects used in integrated pest management

row.entry: 25 or more non-target plants in 5 or more incidents that occur within a calendar month
Any number of non-target plants in a single incident
More than 25% of the tree or shrub exhibits abnormal abscission or abnormal leaf discolouration, or there is a reduction in seed or fruit yield
25% or more of non-target plants within the targeted spray area or within 20 m of its edge in 5 or more incidents that occur within a calendar month
Any percentage of non-target plants in a single incident at any distance from the targeted spray area

Death; injury visible to the naked eye: chlorosis, necrosis, bleaching, vein discolouration or abnormal abscission; terminal bud death; stunted vegetative growth; reduced seed or fruit yield; reduced emergence; abnormal flower quality or number; deformities, for example, in tubers; and epinasty
25% or more of the non-target plants in a body of water in 5 or more incidents that occur within a calendar month
Any percentage of the non-target plants in a body of water in a single incident
Death, abnormal plant stance or abnormal leaf discolouration

Section.Text: The title of the French version of the Pest Control Products Incident Reporting Regulations1 is replaced by the following:

AmendedText.LongTitle: Règlement sur les rapports d’incident relatif aux produits antiparasitaires

Subsection.Text: The definition individual of a species at risk in subsection 1(1) of the Regulations is repealed.
The definition déclaration d’incident in subsection 1(1) of the French version of the Regulations is repealed.
The definition incident in subsection 1(1) of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Definition.Text: incident means an incident whose effects relate to the health or environmental risks or the value of a pest control product. It does not include an incident that results from

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an act or activity that constitutes an offence under the Criminal Code; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the exposure of a targeted subject of a pest control product that is manufactured for the purpose of controlling such a subject. (incident)

Subsection.Text: Subsection 1(1) of the Regulations is amended by adding the following in alphabetical order:

Definition.Text: animal means an invertebrate or a vertebrate, other than a human. (animal)

Subsection.Text: Subsection 1(1) of the French version of the Regulations is amended by adding the following in alphabetical order:

Definition.Text: rapport d’incident Rapport qui comporte les renseignements visés à l’article 3 et que le ministre reçoit d’un titulaire ou d’un demandeur d’homologation. (incident report)

Subsection.Text: Subsection 1(2) of the French version of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Subsection.MarginalNote: Application de la définition de rapport d’incident
Subsection.Text: Pour l’application de la définition de rapport d’incident au paragraphe (1), il n’est pas nécessaire que les renseignements soient justifiés ou corroborés par le titulaire ou le demandeur d’homologation pour figurer dans un rapport.

Section.Text: Section 2 of the Regulations is replaced by the following:
Incidents are classified, according to the subject and effects of the exposure to the pest control product, into the following categories:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an incident whose effect is a human death;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that has a major effect on a human, namely, that human had or has symptoms that indicate a condition that could be life-threatening or result in adverse reproductive or developmental effects or in chronic disability;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that has an effect on a human other than the effects set out in paragraph (a) or (b);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an incident whose effect is an animal death or, if the incident occurs in the United States, a domestic animal death;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that has an effect on an animal other than death;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that has an effect on terrestrial or aquatic plants;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: an incident of package failure that could result in the exposure of a human to a pest control product or in injury to a human; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: an incident whose effects are identified in a scientific study, namely, that the effects are observed during a human epidemiological study or a scientific investigation, whether concluded, discontinued or ongoing, and the study or investigation is sponsored by the registrant or applicant and indicates

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any new health or environmental hazard associated with a pest control product,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any health or environmental risk associated with a pest control product that may be greater than the risk determined at the time of registration, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the presence of a previously undetected component or derivative of a pest control product.

Section.Text: Section 6 of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Subsection.Text: Incident reports must be provided in English or French.

In the case of a scientific study published in a language other than English or French, if the translation of the study cannot be completed within the prescribed time for providing the incident report, the registrant or applicant must provide the Minister with a summary of the study, in English or French, when the incident report is provided.
In the case referred to in subsection (2), the registrant or applicant must provide the completed translated study as soon as feasible after the incident report is provided.

Section.Text: The heading before section 7 of the French version of the Regulations is replaced by the following:
Sections 7 to 12 of the Regulations are replaced by the following:

Every registrant and applicant must provide the Minister, in accordance with the time limits specified in sections 10, 11.1 and 12, with any information referred to in subsection 3(1) that they receive about any incident that occurs in Canada and that corresponds to any of the categories set out in paragraphs 2(a) to (g).

Every registrant and applicant must provide the Minister, in accordance with the time limits specified in sections 10 and 12, with any information referred to in subsection 3(1) that they receive about any incident that occurs in the United States and that corresponds to any of the following categories set out in section 2:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an incident whose effect is a human death;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that has a major effect on a human;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an incident whose effect is a domestic animal death.

Section.Text: Every registrant and applicant must provide the Minister, in accordance with the time limit specified in section 11, with any information referred to in subsection 3(2) about an incident whose effects are identified in a scientific study.

Every registrant and applicant must provide an incident report within 15 days after the day on which they receive information about any incident that corresponds to either of the following categories set out in section 2:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an incident whose effect is a human death;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that has a major effect on a human.

Section.Text: Every registrant and applicant must provide an incident report within 30 days after the day on which they receive information about any incident whose effects are identified in a scientific study.

Every registrant and applicant must provide an incident report within 90 days after the day on which they receive information about any incident that occurs in Canada and whose effect is an animal death.

Every registrant and applicant must accumulate the information that they receive in a reporting period set out in column 1 of the table to this section about incidents in the following categories and provide the required incident reports by the time limit set out in column 2:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that occurs in the United States and whose effect is a domestic animal death;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that has an effect on a human other than the effects set out in paragraph 2(a) or (b);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that has an effect on an animal other than death;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an incident that has an effect on terrestrial or aquatic plants; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an incident of package failure that could result in the exposure of a human to a pest control product or in injury to a human.

row.entry: February 28 or, in the case of a leap year, February 29

Section.Text: Section 13 of the Regulations is repealed.
Section 14 of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

A registrant or applicant who, during the year preceding the day on which this section comes into force, accumulates information in accordance with section 13 of these Regulations as they read immediately before that day must provide the incident reports referred to in that section for the portion of the applicable reporting period immediately preceding that day and must do so by February 28, 2022.

Subsection.Text: If a registrant ceases for any reason to be the registrant of a particular pest control product, they must provide the incident reports referred to in sections 10 to 12 and the annual summary referred to in section 15, in respect of any information that they receive about that product before the day on which they cease to be the registrant, either:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: before the day on which they cease to be the registrant; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: on or before the day that is 15 days after that day.

Subsection.Text: If a registrant ceases to be the registrant of a particular pest control product before the end of the reporting period applicable to the information that will be the subject of the incident reports referred to in section 12 or the annual summary referred to in section 15, that reporting period is deemed to end on the day that the registrant ceases to be the registrant.

Section.Text: Section 15 of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Subsection.Text: A registrant must provide the Minister with an annual summary in respect of an active ingredient if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the active ingredient is a component of a pest control product that is the subject of an incident about which the registrant received information during the year; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the active ingredient is implicated in at least 10 incidents of the type set out in paragraph (a), each of which relates to the same type of subject of exposure referred to in section 2, namely, a human, an animal or one set out in paragraphs 2(f) to (h).

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, the term year means a calendar year.
The annual summary must contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of each incident referred to in paragraph (1)(b), the category of incident set out in section 2; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a concise critical analysis of all the data relating to the active ingredient, including a comparison with analyses of past years and commentary on any changes that arose during the year in the risk profile of any pest control product of which the active ingredient is a component.

Subsection.Text: The annual summary must be provided by March 31 of the year that follows the year during which the registrant receives information about the incidents specified in subsection (1).

A registrant who, during the year preceding the day on which this section comes into force, receives information about any incident that is associated with one of its pest control products must also, by the date set out in subsection (3), provide an annual summary in respect of any active ingredient that is a component of one of its pest control products and that is implicated in at least 10 incidents about which it has received information in that calendar year.
The annual summary must contain the information referred to in subsection 15(2) as it read immediately before the day on which this section comes into force.
The annual summary must be provided to the Minister by March 31, 2022.

Section.Text: Section 16 of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Every registrant must provide the Minister with the information referred to in subsection 3(1) that they have received but have not already provided, within 24 hours after the Minister requests it for the purpose of responding to a situation that endangers human health, animal health or terrestrial or aquatic plants.
Section 17 of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Section.MarginalNote: Keep and submit at Minister’s request
Section.Text: Every registrant and applicant must keep a record of every incident report and any information they have that relates to that report for six years after the day on which the report is provided to the Minister. The record must be provided to the Minister, on request, for the purpose of making comparisons or a historical analysis of the incidents or to permit the Minister to exercise powers under the Act.
Section 18 of the French version of the Regulations is replaced by the following:

Subsection.Text: Sous réserve du paragraphe (2), le ministre verse au Registre les rapports d’incident portant sur tout incident dont l’effet est associé à un produit antiparasitaire homologué, y compris tout renseignement additionnel — notamment des avis ou des observations utiles — fourni volontairement par le titulaire ou le demandeur d’homologation à l’appui des rapports.
Le ministre retire des rapports d’incident et des renseignements additionnels tout renseignement personnel au sens de l’article 3 de la Loi sur la protection des renseignements personnels.

Section.Text: The schedule to the Regulations is repealed.

For the purposes of sections 15 and 16 of these Regulations, former Regulations means the Pest Control Products Incident Reporting Regulations as they read immediately before the day on which these Regulations come into force.

Sections 10 to 12 of the former Regulations continue to apply in respect of any information a registrant or applicant receives before the day on which these Regulations come into force about any incident corresponding to the categories set out in those sections.

Subsection 14(3.1) of the former Regulations continues to apply in respect of a registrant that ceases for any reason to be the registrant of a particular pest control product before the day on which these Regulations come into force.
